intro: Xanthosia pinnatisecta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sunhemp, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its finely pinnatisected leaves, which are deeply divided into narrow, linear segments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in spikes, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptability to harsh conditions. Xanthosia pinnatisecta is often used in revegetation projects due to its hardy nature and ability to stabilize soils.
